summary: study aims to identify risk factors of FRI and mono-viral infections in a tropical military environment. military personnel with temperature 37.5 °C, cough and/or sore throat, and personnel with no fever or no respiratory symptoms were recruited as cases and controls. in bunk and at home was a protective factor against FRI. these contact risk factors were similarly observed for the most common viruses detected. Increasing age, smoker, recruit-camp, stay-out personnel with ill household members and stay-in personnel with ill bunkmates were independent risk factors of FRI.
